principle.name: Content Quality Over Quantity
principle.description: Focus on creating high-quality, engaging content rather than simply filling space
principle.rationale: Quality content drives engagement, builds trust, and converts better than generic filler text

example.scenario: Replacing lorem ipsum in a hero section
example.good: "Transform your business with AI-powered solutions that drive real results"
example.bad: "We offer many services that can help your business grow and succeed in the market"

principle.name: Audience-Centric Language
principle.description: Write content that speaks directly to the target audience's needs and aspirations
principle.rationale: Content that resonates with the audience is more likely to engage and convert

example.scenario: Service description for a B2B software company
example.good: "Streamline your workflow and boost team productivity by 40% with our intuitive project management platform"
example.bad: "Our software helps companies manage projects and tasks effectively"

principle.name: SEO Optimization
principle.description: Incorporate relevant keywords naturally while maintaining readability
principle.rationale: Proper SEO helps content get discovered while keeping it engaging for human readers

example.scenario: About page for a web design agency
example.good: "As a leading web design agency in New York, we create stunning, responsive websites that convert visitors into customers"
example.bad: "We make websites. Our web design services include responsive design and we are located in New York."

examples.good: "Boost Your Revenue with Data-Driven Marketing Strategies"

guidelines.guideline: Use title case for main headlines

convention.template:
Start with a compelling opening sentence that hooks the reader.
Break content into short paragraphs (2-4 sentences each) for better readability.
Use bullet points or numbered lists to present multiple points clearly.
Include specific examples and data points when possible to build credibility.
End with a clear transition to the next section or call-to-action.

guidelines.guideline: Break up text with subheadings every 2-3 paragraphs
Use action verbs (Start, Get, Download, Schedule)

tone_variation.name: professional
tone_variation.description: Formal, authoritative tone for corporate and B2B websites

characteristics.characteristic: Uses complete sentences and proper grammar

tone_variation.appropriate_for: Corporate websites, B2B services, financial institutions

tone_variation.name: conversational
tone_variation.description: Friendly, approachable tone for consumer-facing websites

tone_variation.name: technical
tone_variation.description: Precise, detailed tone for technical products and services
tone_variation.appropriate_for: Software products, engineering services, technical tools

pitfall.why_problematic: Makes content sound generic and untrustworthy
pitfall.correct_approach: Use specific, concrete language that clearly communicates value

examples.use: "combine our tools to work better together"

pitfall.why_problematic: Makes content less engaging and harder to read
pitfall.correct_approach: Use active voice to create more dynamic, engaging content

examples.avoid: "Results can be achieved by using our platform"

pitfall.why_problematic: Fails to differentiate from competitors and doesn't build trust
pitfall.correct_approach: Include specific details, examples, and data points

examples.use: "We've helped over 500 businesses increase revenue by an average of 35%"

category.name: before_starting
category.item: Identify the target audience and their primary needs
Determine the appropriate tone and style
Review existing HTML structure and content hierarchy
Note any brand voice or messaging requirements

category.name: during_content_creation
category.item: Write with the audience's perspective in mind
Include specific examples and data when possible

category.name: before_completion
category.item: Read content aloud to check flow and readability
Verify all placeholder text has been replaced
Ensure consistent tone across all sections
Check that CTAs are clear and action-oriented
